description: Primorial primes: form product of first k primes and add 1, then reject unless prime.
comments: Prime numbers that are the sum of two primorial numbers. - _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Nov 08 2010
references: F. Iacobescu, Smarandache Partition Type and Other Sequences, Bull. Pure Appl. Sciences, Vol. 16E, No. 2 (1997), pp. 237-240.
links: M. Fleuren, Factors and primes of Smarandache sequences.

R. Mestrovic, Euclid's theorem on the infinitude of primes: a historical survey of its proofs (300 BC--2012) and another new proof, arXiv preprint arXiv:1202.3670, 2012 - From N. J. A. Sloane, Jun 13 2012
F. Smarandache, Sequences of Numbers Involved in Unsolved Problems.
mathematica: Select[FoldList[Times, 1, Prime[Range[200]]] + 1, PrimeQ]. (* Loreno Heer (helohe(AT)bluewin.ch), Jun 29 2004 *)
prog: (PARI) P=1;print1(2); forprime(p=2,1e6, if(isprime(1+P*=p), print1(", "P+1))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 28 2015
crossrefs: A005234 and A014545 (which are the main entries for this sequence) give more terms.
author: _Murray R. Bremner_
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jun 18 2007
